Stem: Children who play violent video games are more likely to show aggressive behavior in school. Give one reason why this might be true, other than playing violent video games causing aggressive behavior.

RunsThroughA.text: The games desensitize children to violence, making them more likely to act aggressively.
RunsThroughA.explanation: This is A->B (Desensitization). This is the mechanism by which games cause aggression.

RunsThroughA.text: Children imitate the violent behaviors they practice in the video games.
RunsThroughA.explanation: This is A->B (Social Learning/Imitation). This is the mechanism by which games cause aggression.

RunsThroughA.text: Playing the games makes them frustrated, and this frustration leads to aggression at school.
RunsThroughA.explanation: This is A->Mediator->B. Frustration (Mediator) is caused by playing the game (A).

RunsThroughA.text: Playing video games takes time away from learning social skills, which leads to aggression.
RunsThroughA.explanation: This is A->Displacement->B. Gaming (A) displaces social learning, leading to aggression (B). This relies on A causing the outcome.
